(Television in Instruction)
Television cannot be evaluated in terms of ’’subjects" -- history and
science, reading and art. To do so would be to misrepresent both the learning
process and.television as a means of communication.
Of course the particular purpose television can serve in one subject area
may be different from that which it serves in another. But fundamentally the
frame of reference should be THE BROAD ELEMENTS OF LEARNING, regardless
of the subject being taught.
TELEVISION CAN BRING TO THE CLASSROOM A VARIETY OF
LEARNING SITUATIONS IN EVERY SUBJECT AREA.
